sentences.en: A free radical is a molecular fragment having an unpaired electron.
sentences.cn: 自由基是一种具有未配对电子的分子碎体.

sentences.en: A new technological marvel was invented at Cambridge University in England, the scanning electron microscope.
sentences.cn: 一项科技新奇迹在英国剑桥大学诞生了——这就是扫描电子显微镜。

sentences.en: An axial electron pair meets at right angles with 3 neighboring pairs.
sentences.cn: 轴向电子对与三个相邻的电子对相交成直角.

sentences.en: An electron has a negative charge, a proton has a positive charge.
sentences.cn: 电子带负电荷, 质子带正电荷.

sentences.en: An electron in the innermost orbit has the least energy.
sentences.cn: 最里面的轨道上的电子能量最低.

sentences.en: Electron microscopy has revolutionized the study of crystal imperfections.
sentences.cn: 电子显微学已经革新了对晶体不完整性的研究.

sentences.en: Electron spin is essential in understanding many atomic phenomena.
sentences.cn: 电子自旋对于理解许多原子现象是很重要的.

sentences.en: Freedom, gravity, ego, and electron are constructs.
sentences.cn: 自由, 万有引力, 自我中心以及电子都是概念.

sentences.en: In aerobic systems, oxygen is the terminal electron acceptor and is reduced.
sentences.cn: 在需氧体系中, 氧是末端电子接受体并且被还原.

sentences.en: In aprotic acids, it is some other electron - deficient element.
sentences.cn: 在无质子的酸中, 它是另一种缺电子元素.

sentences.en: Magnetic coils focus the electron beams into fine spots.
sentences.cn: 磁线圈把电子束聚焦成微小的点。

sentences.en: Most things are balanced - with equal numbers of electrons and protons.
sentences.cn: 大部分物体都是电荷平衡的——含等量的电子和质子。

sentences.en: The electron clouds are clearly visible as blurs surrounding the invisible nuclei.
sentences.cn: 电子云就象环绕着看不见的核的一片云雾.

sentences.en: The electron microscope uses a beam of electrons to produce images at high magnifications.
sentences.cn: 电子显微镜利用电子束形成高倍影像。

sentences.en: The schroedinger equation for the one - electron atom is exactly soluble.
sentences.cn: 单电子原子的薛定谔方程是可精确求解的.

sentences.en: The structure of molecules can be seen under an electron microscope.
sentences.cn: 分子的结构可在电子显微镜下观察到.

phrases.tran_cn: 电子显微镜学，电子显微镜
扫描电子显微镜检查法

trans.tran_en: a very small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge that moves around the nucleus(= central part ) of an atom
